{{< include _lexicon-styles.qmd >}}

This page documents the [ATProto Lexicon](https://atproto.com/specs/lexicon)
definitions that make up the `science.alt.dataset` namespace. These
lexicons define the record types, objects, tokens, and queries used by
atdata for publishing schemas, datasets, and lenses to the AT Protocol
network.

All lexicons conform to ATProto Lexicon version 1 and are published
from the canonical source in
[`lexicons/`](https://github.com/forecast-bio/atdata/tree/main/lexicons).

::: {.callout-note}
## Reading this reference

Each entry shows the **NSID** (Namespaced Identifier), its **type**
(Record, Object, Token, Query, or String), and a property table with
type information and constraints.  Internal cross-references link to
auxiliary definitions within the same namespace.
:::

## Definitions

### `science.alt.dataset.schema` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-record'>Record</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-schema}

Definition of a PackableSample-compatible sample type. Supports versioning via rkey format: {NSID}@{semver}. Schema format is extensible via union type.

**Record key:** `any`

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `name` | string | **yes** | Human-readable display name for this sample type. Used for documentation and UI. The NSID in the record URI provides unique identification; name collisions across NSIDs are acceptable. *max length: 100* |
| `version` | string | **yes** | Semantic version (e.g., '1.0.0') *max length: 100* · *pattern: `^(0\|[1-9]\d*)\.(0\|[1-9]\d*)\.(0\|[1-9]\d*)(?:-((?:0\|[1-9]\d*\|\d*[a-zA-Z-][0-9a-zA-Z-]*)(?:\.(?:0\|[1-9]\d*\|\d*[a-zA-Z-][0-9a-zA-Z-]*))*))?(?:\+([0-9a-zA-Z-]+(?:\.[0-9a-zA-Z-]+)*))?$`* |
| `schemaType` | [`science.alt.dataset.schemaType`](#ac-foundation-dataset-schematype) | **yes** | Type of schema definition. This field indicates which union member is present in the schema field. |
| `schema` | [`science.alt.dataset.schema#jsonSchemaFormat`](#ac-foundation-dataset-schema-jsonschemaformat) | **yes** | Schema definition for this sample type. Currently supports JSON Schema Draft 7. Union allows for future schema formats (Avro, Protobuf, etc.) without breaking changes. |
| `description` | string | no | Human-readable description of what this sample type represents *max length: 5000* |
| `metadata` | object | no | Optional metadata about this schema. Common fields include license and tags, but any additional fields are permitted. *max properties: 50* |
| `createdAt` | string (datetime) | **yes** | Timestamp when this schema version was created. Immutable once set (ATProto records are permanent). |
| `atdataSchemaVersion` | integer | no | Format version discriminator for the schema record itself. Used to detect breaking changes in the record structure. When absent, treated as version 1 for backward compatibility. *min: 1* |

#### `science.alt.dataset.schema#jsonSchemaFormat` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-object'>Object</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-schema-jsonschemaformat}

JSON Schema Draft 7 format for sample type definitions. Used with NDArray shim for array types.

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `$type` | string | **yes** |  *const: `science.alt.dataset.schema#jsonSchemaFormat`* |
| `$schema` | string | **yes** | JSON Schema version identifier *const: `http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#`* |
| `type` | string | **yes** | Sample types must be objects *const: `object`* |
| `properties` | object | **yes** | Field definitions for the sample type *min properties: 1* |
| `arrayFormatVersions` | object | no | Mapping from array format identifiers to semantic versions. Keys are science.alt.dataset.arrayFormat values (e.g., 'ndarrayBytes'), values are semver strings (e.g., '1.0.0'). Alt.science maintains canonical shim schemas at https://alt.science/schemas/atdata-{format}-bytes/{version}/. *max properties: 10* |

---

### `science.alt.dataset.entry` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-record'>Record</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-entry}

Index entry for a WebDataset-backed dataset with references to storage location and sample schema

**Record key:** `tid`

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `name` | string | **yes** | Human-readable dataset name *max length: 200* |
| `schemaRef` | string (at-uri) | **yes** | AT-URI reference to the schema record for this dataset's samples *max length: 500* |
| `storage` | [`science.alt.dataset.storageHttp`](#ac-foundation-dataset-storagehttp) \| [`science.alt.dataset.storageS3`](#ac-foundation-dataset-storages3) \| [`science.alt.dataset.storageBlobs`](#ac-foundation-dataset-storageblobs) | **yes** | Storage location for dataset files (WebDataset tar archives) |
| `description` | string | no | Human-readable description of the dataset *max length: 5000* |
| `metadata` | bytes | no | Msgpack-encoded metadata dict for arbitrary extended key-value pairs. Use this for additional metadata beyond the core top-level fields (license, tags, size). Top-level fields are preferred for discoverable/searchable metadata. *max length: 100000* |
| `tags` | array\<string\> | no | Searchable tags for dataset discovery. Aligns with Schema.org keywords property. *max length: 30* |
| `size` | [`#datasetSize`](#ac-foundation-dataset-entry-datasetsize) | no | Dataset size information (optional) |
| `license` | string | no | License identifier or URL. SPDX identifiers recommended (e.g., MIT, Apache-2.0, CC-BY-4.0) or full SPDX URLs (e.g., http://spdx.org/licenses/MIT). Aligns with Schema.org license property. *max length: 200* |
| `createdAt` | string (datetime) | **yes** | Timestamp when this dataset entry was created |
| `metadataSchemaRef` | string (at-uri) | no | AT-URI reference to a schema record defining the structure of this dataset's content metadata. When present, contentMetadata is validated against this schema at write time. *max length: 500* |
| `contentMetadata` | unknown | no | Dataset-level content metadata (e.g., instrument settings, acquisition parameters). Structure is validated against the schema referenced by metadataSchemaRef when present. Stored as an open JSON object. |
| `manifests` | array\<[`#shardManifestRef`](#ac-foundation-dataset-entry-shardmanifestref)\> | no | Per-shard manifest metadata for query-based access. Each entry corresponds to a shard in the storage union (matched by array index). Optional — datasets without manifests are still fully usable via sequential iteration. |

#### `science.alt.dataset.entry#shardManifestRef` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-object'>Object</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-entry-shardmanifestref}

References to manifest sidecar data for a single shard. The header contains schema info, sample count, and per-field aggregates. The samples file is a Parquet table with per-sample metadata for query-based access.

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `header` | blob (application/json) | **yes** | Manifest JSON header containing schema info, sample count, and per-field aggregates (min/max/mean for numeric, value_counts for categorical) *max size: 1 MB* |
| `samples` | blob (application/octet-stream) | no | Parquet file with per-sample metadata (\_\_key\_\_, \_\_offset\_\_, \_\_size\_\_, plus queryable field values) *max size: 50 MB* |

#### `science.alt.dataset.entry#shardChecksum` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-object'>Object</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-entry-shardchecksum}

Content hash for shard integrity verification. Algorithm is flexible to allow SHA-256, BLAKE3, or other hash functions.

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `algorithm` | string | **yes** | Hash algorithm identifier (e.g., 'sha256', 'blake3') *max length: 20* |
| `digest` | string | **yes** | Hex-encoded hash digest *max length: 128* |

#### `science.alt.dataset.entry#datasetSize` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-object'>Object</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-entry-datasetsize}

Information about dataset size

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `samples` | integer | no | Total number of samples in the dataset *min: 0* |
| `bytes` | integer | no | Total size in bytes *min: 0* |
| `shards` | integer | no | Number of WebDataset shards *min: 1* |

---

### `science.alt.dataset.lens` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-record'>Record</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-lens}

Bidirectional transformation (Lens) between two sample types, with code stored in external repositories

**Record key:** `tid`

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `name` | string | **yes** | Human-readable lens name *max length: 100* |
| `sourceSchema` | string (at-uri) | **yes** | AT-URI reference to source schema *max length: 500* |
| `targetSchema` | string (at-uri) | **yes** | AT-URI reference to target schema *max length: 500* |
| `description` | string | no | What this transformation does *max length: 1000* |
| `getterCode` | [`#codeReference`](#ac-foundation-dataset-lens-codereference) | **yes** | Code reference for getter function (Source -> Target) |
| `putterCode` | [`#codeReference`](#ac-foundation-dataset-lens-codereference) | **yes** | Code reference for putter function (Target, Source -> Source) |
| `language` | string | no | Programming language of the lens implementation (e.g., 'python', 'typescript') *max length: 50* |
| `metadata` | object | no | Arbitrary metadata (author, performance notes, etc.) |
| `createdAt` | string (datetime) | **yes** | Timestamp when this lens was created |

#### `science.alt.dataset.lens#codeReference` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-object'>Object</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-lens-codereference}

Reference to code in an external repository (GitHub, tangled.org, etc.)

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `repository` | string | **yes** | Repository URL (e.g., 'https://github.com/user/repo' or 'at://did/tangled.repo/...') *max length: 500* |
| `commit` | string | **yes** | Git commit hash (ensures immutability) *max length: 40* |
| `path` | string | **yes** | Path to function within repository (e.g., 'lenses/vision.py:rgb_to_grayscale') *max length: 500* |
| `branch` | string | no | Optional branch name (for reference, commit hash is authoritative) *max length: 100* |

---

### `science.alt.dataset.storageHttp` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-object'>Object</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-storagehttp}

HTTP/HTTPS storage for WebDataset tar archives. Each shard is listed individually with a checksum for integrity verification. Consumers build brace-expansion patterns on the fly when needed.

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `shards` | array\<[`#shardEntry`](#ac-foundation-dataset-storagehttp-shardentry)\> | **yes** | Array of shard entries with URL and integrity checksum *min length: 1* |

#### `science.alt.dataset.storageHttp#shardEntry` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-object'>Object</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-storagehttp-shardentry}

A single HTTP-accessible shard with integrity checksum

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `url` | string (uri) | **yes** | HTTP/HTTPS URL for this WebDataset tar shard *max length: 2000* |
| `checksum` | [`science.alt.dataset.entry#shardChecksum`](#ac-foundation-dataset-entry-shardchecksum) | **yes** | Content hash for integrity verification |

---

### `science.alt.dataset.storageS3` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-object'>Object</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-storages3}

S3 or S3-compatible storage for WebDataset tar archives. Supports custom endpoints for MinIO, Cloudflare R2, and other S3-compatible services.

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `bucket` | string | **yes** | S3 bucket name *max length: 255* |
| `region` | string | no | AWS region (e.g., 'us-east-1'). Optional for S3-compatible services. *max length: 50* |
| `endpoint` | string (uri) | no | Custom S3-compatible endpoint URL (e.g., for MinIO, Cloudflare R2). Omit for standard AWS S3. *max length: 500* |
| `shards` | array\<[`#shardEntry`](#ac-foundation-dataset-storages3-shardentry)\> | **yes** | Array of shard entries with object key and integrity checksum *min length: 1* |

#### `science.alt.dataset.storageS3#shardEntry` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-object'>Object</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-storages3-shardentry}

A single S3 object shard with integrity checksum

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `key` | string | **yes** | S3 object key for this WebDataset tar shard *max length: 1024* |
| `checksum` | [`science.alt.dataset.entry#shardChecksum`](#ac-foundation-dataset-entry-shardchecksum) | **yes** | Content hash for integrity verification |

---

### `science.alt.dataset.storageBlobs` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-object'>Object</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-storageblobs}

Storage via ATProto PDS blobs for WebDataset tar archives. Used in science.alt.dataset.entry storage union for maximum decentralization.

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `blobs` | array\<[`#blobEntry`](#ac-foundation-dataset-storageblobs-blobentry)\> | **yes** | Array of blob entries for WebDataset tar files *min length: 1* |

#### `science.alt.dataset.storageBlobs#blobEntry` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-object'>Object</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-storageblobs-blobentry}

A single PDS blob shard with optional integrity checksum

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `blob` | blob | **yes** | Blob reference to a WebDataset tar archive *accept: `application/x-tar`* · *max size: 50 MB* |
| `checksum` | [`science.alt.dataset.entry#shardChecksum`](#ac-foundation-dataset-entry-shardchecksum) | no | Content hash for integrity verification (optional since PDS blobs have built-in CID integrity) |

---

### `science.alt.dataset.storageExternal` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-object'>Object</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-storageexternal}

::: {.callout-warning}
This type is deprecated.
:::

(Deprecated: use storageHttp or storageS3 instead.) External storage via URLs for WebDataset tar archives. URLs support brace notation for sharding (e.g., 'data-{000000..000099}.tar').

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `urls` | array\<string (uri)\> | **yes** | WebDataset URLs with optional brace notation for sharded tar files *min length: 1* |

---

### `science.alt.dataset.schemaType` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-string'>String</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-schematype}

Schema type identifier for atdata sample definitions. Known values correspond to token definitions in this Lexicon. New schema types can be added as tokens without breaking changes.

*max length: 50* · *known values: `jsonSchema`*

#### `science.alt.dataset.schemaType#jsonSchema` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-token'>Token</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-schematype-jsonschema}

JSON Schema Draft 7 format for sample type definitions. When schemaType is 'jsonSchema', the schema field must contain an object conforming to science.alt.dataset.schema#jsonSchemaFormat.

---

### `science.alt.dataset.arrayFormat` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-string'>String</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-arrayformat}

Array serialization format identifier for NDArray fields in sample schemas. Known values correspond to token definitions in this Lexicon. Each format has versioned specifications maintained by alt.science at canonical URLs.

*max length: 50* · *known values: `ndarrayBytes`*

#### `science.alt.dataset.arrayFormat#ndarrayBytes` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-token'>Token</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-arrayformat-ndarraybytes}

Numpy .npy binary format for NDArray serialization. Stores arrays with dtype and shape in binary header. Versions maintained at https://alt.science/schemas/atdata-ndarray-bytes/{version}/

---

### `science.alt.dataset.resolveSchema` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-query'>Query</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-resolveschema}

Resolve a schema by its permanent NSID identifier. When version is omitted, resolves to the most recently created schema with the given NSID.

#### Parameters

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `handle` | string | **yes** | DID or handle of the schema owner |
| `schemaId` | string | **yes** | The permanent NSID identifier for the schema (the {NSID} part of the rkey {NSID}@{semver}) *max length: 500* |
| `version` | string | no | Specific version to resolve. If omitted, resolves to latest. *max length: 20* |

#### Output

Encoding: `application/json`

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `uri` | string (at-uri) | **yes** | AT-URI of the resolved schema record |
| `cid` | string | **yes** | CID of the resolved schema record |
| `record` | [`science.alt.dataset.schema`](#ac-foundation-dataset-schema) | **yes** | The full schema record |

#### Errors

- **SchemaNotFound** — No schema found with the given NSID

---

### `science.alt.dataset.label` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-record'>Record</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-label}

Named label pointing to a dataset record. Multiple labels with the same name but different versions can coexist, enabling versioned references to immutable dataset records.

**Record key:** `tid`

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `name` | string | **yes** | User-facing label name, e.g. 'mnist' *max length: 200* |
| `datasetUri` | string (at-uri) | **yes** | AT-URI pointing to the dataset record this label refers to *max length: 500* |
| `version` | string | no | Semver or free-form version string, e.g. '1.0.1'. When omitted, the label is unversioned. *max length: 50* |
| `description` | string | no | Optional description of this labeled version *max length: 5000* |
| `createdAt` | string (datetime) | **yes** | Timestamp when this label was created |

---

### `science.alt.dataset.resolveLabel` <span class='lexicon-badge lexicon-badge-query'>Query</span> {#ac-foundation-dataset-resolvelabel}

Resolve a named dataset label to its underlying dataset record. When version is omitted, resolves to the most recently created label with the given name.

#### Parameters

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `handle` | string | **yes** | DID or handle of the dataset owner |
| `name` | string | **yes** | Label name, e.g. 'mnist' |
| `version` | string | no | Specific version to resolve. If omitted, resolves to latest. |

#### Output

Encoding: `application/json`

| Property | Type | Required | Description |
|----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `uri` | string (at-uri) | **yes** | AT-URI of the resolved dataset record |
| `cid` | string | **yes** | CID of the resolved dataset record |
| `label` | [`science.alt.dataset.label#main`](#ac-foundation-dataset-label-main) | **yes** | The label record that was resolved |
